trans-unit.target: A Closer Look at Azure SQL Database and SQL Server in Azure VM

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft Azure SQL Database (Azure SQL Database)** is a relational database-as-a-service, which falls into the industry category *Platform as a Service (PaaS)*.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft Azure SQL Database (Azure SQL Database)** is a relational database-as-a-service, which falls into the industry category *Platform as a Service (PaaS)*.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database is built on standardized hardware and software that is owned, hosted, and maintained by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database is built on standardized hardware and software that is owned, hosted, and maintained by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: With SQL Database, you can develop directly on the service using built-in features and functionality.
trans-unit.target: With SQL Database, you can develop directly on the service using built-in features and functionality.

trans-unit.source: When using SQL Database, you pay-as-you-go with options to scale up or out for greater power.
trans-unit.target: When using SQL Database, you pay-as-you-go with options to scale up or out for greater power.

trans-unit.source: **SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machine (VM)** falls into the industry category *Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)* and allows you to run SQL Server inside a virtual machine in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: **SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machine (VM)** falls into the industry category *Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)* and allows you to run SQL Server inside a virtual machine in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Similar to Azure SQL Database, it is built on standardized hardware that is owned, hosted, and maintained by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Similar to Azure SQL Database, it is built on standardized hardware that is owned, hosted, and maintained by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: When using SQL Server in a VM, you can either bring your own SQL Server license to Azure or use one of the preconfigured SQL Server images in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: When using SQL Server in a VM, you can either bring your own SQL Server license to Azure or use one of the preconfigured SQL Server images in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: In general, these two SQL options are optimized for different purposes:
trans-unit.target: In general, these two SQL options are optimized for different purposes:

trans-unit.source: **Azure SQL Database** is optimized to reduce overall costs to the minimum for provisioning and managing many databases.
trans-unit.target: **Azure SQL Database** is optimized to reduce overall costs to the minimum for provisioning and managing many databases.

trans-unit.source: It minimizes ongoing administration costs because you do not have to manage any virtual machines, operating system or database software including upgrades, high availability, and backups.
trans-unit.target: It minimizes ongoing administration costs because you do not have to manage any virtual machines, operating system or database software including upgrades, high availability, and backups.

trans-unit.source: In general, SQL Database can dramatically increase the number of databases managed by a single IT or development resource.
trans-unit.target: In general, SQL Database can dramatically increase the number of databases managed by a single IT or development resource.

trans-unit.source: **SQL Server running in Azure VM** is optimized for extending existing on-premises SQL Server applications to Azure in a hybrid scenario or deploying an existing application to Azure in a migration scenario or dev/test scenario.
trans-unit.target: **SQL Server running in Azure VM** is optimized for extending existing on-premises SQL Server applications to Azure in a hybrid scenario or deploying an existing application to Azure in a migration scenario or dev/test scenario.

trans-unit.source: An example of the hybrid scenario is keeping secondary database replicas in Azure via [Azure Virtual Network](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: An example of the hybrid scenario is keeping secondary database replicas in Azure via [Azure Virtual Network](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: With SQL Server in Azure VMs, you have the full administrative rights over a dedicated SQL Server instance and a cloud-based VM.
trans-unit.target: With SQL Server in Azure VMs, you have the full administrative rights over a dedicated SQL Server instance and a cloud-based VM.

trans-unit.source: It is a perfect choice when an organization already has IT resources available to maintain the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: It is a perfect choice when an organization already has IT resources available to maintain the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: With SQL Server in VM, you can build a highly customized system to address your application’s specific performance and availability requirements.
trans-unit.target: With SQL Server in VM, you can build a highly customized system to address your application’s specific performance and availability requirements.

trans-unit.source: Billing and licensing basics
trans-unit.target: Billing and licensing basics

trans-unit.source: **Azure SQL Database** is sold to customers as a service not with a license whereas SQL Server in Azure VM requires traditional SQL Server licensing.
trans-unit.target: **Azure SQL Database** is sold to customers as a service not with a license whereas SQL Server in Azure VM requires traditional SQL Server licensing.

trans-unit.source: Currently, **Azure SQL Database** is available in several service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Currently, **Azure SQL Database** is available in several service tiers.

trans-unit.source: For Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers, you are billed hourly at a fixed rate based on the service tier and performance level you choose.
trans-unit.target: For Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers, you are billed hourly at a fixed rate based on the service tier and performance level you choose.

trans-unit.source: The Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers are designed to deliver predictable performance with multiple performance levels to match your application’s peak requirements.
trans-unit.target: The Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers are designed to deliver predictable performance with multiple performance levels to match your application’s peak requirements.

trans-unit.source: You can change between service tiers and performance levels to match your application’s varied throughput needs.
trans-unit.target: You can change between service tiers and performance levels to match your application’s varied throughput needs.

trans-unit.source: For the latest information on the current supported service tiers, see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers (Editions)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn741340.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For the latest information on the current supported service tiers, see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers (Editions)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn741340.aspx).

trans-unit.source: With **Azure SQL Database**, the database software is automatically configured, patched, and upgraded by Microsoft Azure in data centers all over the world.
trans-unit.target: With **Azure SQL Database**, the database software is automatically configured, patched, and upgraded by Microsoft Azure in data centers all over the world.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you gain reduced administration costs.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you gain reduced administration costs.

trans-unit.source: In addition, its [built-in backup](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj650016.aspx) capabilities help you achieve significant cost savings, especially, when you have large number of databases.
trans-unit.target: In addition, its [built-in backup](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj650016.aspx) capabilities help you achieve significant cost savings, especially, when you have large number of databases.

trans-unit.source: When using Azure SQL Database, you are not billed for individual queries running against Azure SQL Database or incoming internet traffic.
trans-unit.target: When using Azure SQL Database, you are not billed for individual queries running against Azure SQL Database or incoming internet traffic.

trans-unit.source: You are billed for [outgoing internet traffic](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/data-transfers/).
trans-unit.target: You are billed for [outgoing internet traffic](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/data-transfers/).

trans-unit.source: If your database has high transactional volume and need to support many concurrent users, we recommend that you use Premium rather than Basic or Standard service tiers.
trans-unit.target: If your database has high transactional volume and need to support many concurrent users, we recommend that you use Premium rather than Basic or Standard service tiers.

trans-unit.source: With **SQL Server in Azure VM**, you utilize traditional SQL Server licensing.
trans-unit.target: With **SQL Server in Azure VM**, you utilize traditional SQL Server licensing.

trans-unit.source: You can either use the platform-provided SQL Server image or bring your SQL Server license to Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can either use the platform-provided SQL Server image or bring your SQL Server license to Azure.

trans-unit.source: When using the SQL Server platform provided images, the cost depends on the VM size as well as the version of SQL Server you choose.
trans-unit.target: When using the SQL Server platform provided images, the cost depends on the VM size as well as the version of SQL Server you choose.

trans-unit.source: Basically, you pay per minute licensing cost of SQL Server, the per-minute licensing of Windows Server, and the Azure storage cost.
trans-unit.target: Basically, you pay per minute licensing cost of SQL Server, the per-minute licensing of Windows Server, and the Azure storage cost.

trans-unit.source: The per-minute billing option allows you to use SQL Server for as long as you need it without buying full SQL Server license.
trans-unit.target: The per-minute billing option allows you to use SQL Server for as long as you need it without buying full SQL Server license.

trans-unit.source: If you bring your own SQL Server license to Azure, you are charged for Azure compute and storage costs only.
trans-unit.target: If you bring your own SQL Server license to Azure, you are charged for Azure compute and storage costs only.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [License Mobility through Software Assurance on Azure](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/license-mobility/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [License Mobility through Software Assurance on Azure](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/license-mobility/).

trans-unit.target: Administration

trans-unit.source: If your hands are already full of so many tasks, perhaps taking on server and database administration is not something you’re looking forward to.
trans-unit.target: If your hands are already full of so many tasks, perhaps taking on server and database administration is not something you’re looking forward to.

trans-unit.source: For many businesses, the decision to go with a cloud service is all about the ability to offload the complexity of administration.
trans-unit.target: For many businesses, the decision to go with a cloud service is all about the ability to offload the complexity of administration.

trans-unit.source: With **Azure SQL Database**, Microsoft administers the physical hardware such as hard drives, servers, and storage; automatically replicates all data to provide high availability; configures and upgrades the database software; manages load balancing; and does transparent failover if there is a server failure.
trans-unit.target: With **Azure SQL Database**, Microsoft administers the physical hardware such as hard drives, servers, and storage; automatically replicates all data to provide high availability; configures and upgrades the database software; manages load balancing; and does transparent failover if there is a server failure.

trans-unit.source: You can continue to administer your Azure SQL Database instances but without controlling the physical resources of the underlying SQL Server instance and of the Azure platform.
trans-unit.target: You can continue to administer your Azure SQL Database instances but without controlling the physical resources of the underlying SQL Server instance and of the Azure platform.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can administer databases and logins, do index tuning, and optimize queries, but cannot administer system tables and filegroup management.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can administer databases and logins, do index tuning, and optimize queries, but cannot administer system tables and filegroup management.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure SQL Database Guidelines and Limitations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff394102.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure SQL Database Guidelines and Limitations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff394102.aspx).

trans-unit.source: On the other hand, you might have in-house expertise and a desire to keep control over database location down to the machine itself.
trans-unit.target: On the other hand, you might have in-house expertise and a desire to keep control over database location down to the machine itself.

trans-unit.source: With **SQL Server running in Azure VM**, you have full control over the operating system and SQL Server instance configuration.
trans-unit.target: With **SQL Server running in Azure VM**, you have full control over the operating system and SQL Server instance configuration.

trans-unit.source: With a VM, it’s up to you to decide when to update/upgrade the operating system and database software, and when to install any additional software such as anti-virus and backup tools.
trans-unit.target: With a VM, it’s up to you to decide when to update/upgrade the operating system and database software, and when to install any additional software such as anti-virus and backup tools.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can control the size of the VM, the number of disks, and their storage configurations.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can control the size of the VM, the number of disks, and their storage configurations.

trans-unit.source: For example, Azure allows you to change the size of a running VM as needed.
trans-unit.target: For example, Azure allows you to change the size of a running VM as needed.

trans-unit.target: For information, see [Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-size-specs).

trans-unit.source: Service level agreement (SLA)
trans-unit.target: Service level agreement (SLA)

trans-unit.source: For some of us, meeting the up-time obligations of a Service Level Agreement (SLA) is the top priority.
trans-unit.target: For some of us, meeting the up-time obligations of a Service Level Agreement (SLA) is the top priority.

trans-unit.source: In this section, we look at what SLA means for each database hosting option.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we look at what SLA means for each database hosting option.

trans-unit.source: For **Azure SQL Database**, given the Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers, Microsoft provides an availability SLA of 99.99%.
trans-unit.target: For **Azure SQL Database**, given the Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers, Microsoft provides an availability SLA of 99.99%.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the availability SLA addresses the ability to connect to the database.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the availability SLA addresses the ability to connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: In other words, it is a database-level SLA.
trans-unit.target: In other words, it is a database-level SLA.

trans-unit.source: For the latest information on SLAs, see [Service Level Agreement](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/sla/).
trans-unit.target: For the latest information on SLAs, see [Service Level Agreement](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/sla/).

trans-unit.source: For the latest information on Azure SQL Database Service Tiers (Editions) and the supported business continuity plans, see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn741340.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For the latest information on Azure SQL Database Service Tiers (Editions) and the supported business continuity plans, see [Azure SQL Database Service Tiers](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn741340.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For **Virtual Machines hosted in Azure**, Microsoft provides an availability SLA of 99.95% and this availability is for the VM, not for the processes running inside the VM (such as, SQL Server).
trans-unit.target: For **Virtual Machines hosted in Azure**, Microsoft provides an availability SLA of 99.95% and this availability is for the VM, not for the processes running inside the VM (such as, SQL Server).

trans-unit.source: The [VM SLA](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=38427) requires that you host at least two VMs in an availability set.
trans-unit.target: The [VM SLA](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=38427) requires that you host at least two VMs in an availability set.

trans-unit.source: With such configuration, Azure guarantees that at least one of the VMs will be available 99.95% of the time.
trans-unit.target: With such configuration, Azure guarantees that at least one of the VMs will be available 99.95% of the time.

trans-unit.source: For database high availability (HA) within VMs, you should configure one of the supported high availability options in SQL Server, such as AlwaysOn Availability Groups.
trans-unit.target: For database high availability (HA) within VMs, you should configure one of the supported high availability options in SQL Server, such as AlwaysOn Availability Groups.

trans-unit.source: Note that setting up AlwaysOn in Azure requires some manual configuration and management, and you pay extra for each secondary you operate.
trans-unit.target: Note that setting up AlwaysOn in Azure requires some manual configuration and management, and you pay extra for each secondary you operate.

trans-unit.source: Time to market
trans-unit.target: Time to market

trans-unit.source: **Azure SQL Database** is the right solution for cloud-designed applications when developer productivity and fast time-to-market are critical.
trans-unit.target: **Azure SQL Database** is the right solution for cloud-designed applications when developer productivity and fast time-to-market are critical.

trans-unit.source: With programmatic DBA-like functionality, it is perfect for cloud architects and developers as it lowers the need for managing the underlying operating system and database.
trans-unit.target: With programmatic DBA-like functionality, it is perfect for cloud architects and developers as it lowers the need for managing the underlying operating system and database.

trans-unit.source: It helps developers understand and configure database-related tasks.
trans-unit.target: It helps developers understand and configure database-related tasks.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can use the [REST API](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn505719.aspx) and [PowerShell cmdlets](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn546726.aspx) to automate and manage administrative operations for thousands of databases.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can use the [REST API](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn505719.aspx) and [PowerShell cmdlets](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn546726.aspx) to automate and manage administrative operations for thousands of databases.

trans-unit.source: With [elastic scale](sql-database-elastic-pool.md) in the cloud, you can easily focus on the application layer and deliver your application to the market faster.
trans-unit.target: With [elastic scale](sql-database-elastic-pool.md) in the cloud, you can easily focus on the application layer and deliver your application to the market faster.

trans-unit.source: **SQL Server running in Azure VM** is perfect if your existing and new applications require access and control to all features of a SQL Server instance, and when you want to migrate existing on-premises applications and databases to the cloud as-is.
trans-unit.target: **SQL Server running in Azure VM** is perfect if your existing and new applications require access and control to all features of a SQL Server instance, and when you want to migrate existing on-premises applications and databases to the cloud as-is.

trans-unit.source: Since you do not need to change the presentation, application, and data layers, you save time and budget on rearchitecting your existing solution.
trans-unit.target: Since you do not need to change the presentation, application, and data layers, you save time and budget on rearchitecting your existing solution.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you can focus on migrating all your solution packages to the VMs and doing some performance optimizations required by the Azure platform.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you can focus on migrating all your solution packages to the VMs and doing some performance optimizations required by the Azure platform.

trans-unit.source: For information, see [Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-sql-server-performance-best-practices).
trans-unit.target: For information, see [Performance Best Practices for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-sql-server-performance-best-practices).

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: In this article, we explored: Azure SQL Database and SQL Server in Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: In this article, we explored: Azure SQL Database and SQL Server in Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: In addition, we discussed common business motivators that might affect decision making on which one to choose.
trans-unit.target: In addition, we discussed common business motivators that might affect decision making on which one to choose.

trans-unit.source: The following is a summary of suggestions for you to consider when to use one or the other:
trans-unit.target: The following is a summary of suggestions for you to consider when to use one or the other:

trans-unit.source: Choose **Azure SQL Database**, if:
trans-unit.target: Choose **Azure SQL Database**, if:

trans-unit.source: You are building brand new, cloud-based applications; or you want to migrate your existing SQL Server database to Azure and your database is not using one of the unsupported functionalities in Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: You are building brand new, cloud-based applications; or you want to migrate your existing SQL Server database to Azure and your database is not using one of the unsupported functionalities in Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure SQL Database Transact-SQL Reference](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee336281.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure SQL Database Transact-SQL Reference](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee336281.aspx).

trans-unit.source: This approach provides the benefits of a fully managed cloud service and ensures the fast time-to-market.
trans-unit.target: This approach provides the benefits of a fully managed cloud service and ensures the fast time-to-market.

trans-unit.source: You want to have Microsoft perform common management operations on your databases and require stronger availability SLAs for databases.
trans-unit.target: You want to have Microsoft perform common management operations on your databases and require stronger availability SLAs for databases.

trans-unit.source: This approach can minimize the administration costs and at the same time provides a guaranteed availability for the database.
trans-unit.target: This approach can minimize the administration costs and at the same time provides a guaranteed availability for the database.

trans-unit.source: Choose **SQL Server in Azure VM**, if:
trans-unit.target: Choose **SQL Server in Azure VM**, if:

trans-unit.source: You have existing on-premises applications and wish to stop maintaining your own hardware or you consider hybrid solutions.
trans-unit.target: You have existing on-premises applications and wish to stop maintaining your own hardware or you consider hybrid solutions.

trans-unit.source: This approach lets you get access to high database capacity faster and also connects your on-premises applications to the cloud via a secure tunnel.
trans-unit.target: This approach lets you get access to high database capacity faster and also connects your on-premises applications to the cloud via a secure tunnel.

trans-unit.source: You have existing IT resources, need full administrative rights over SQL Server, and require the full compatibility with on-premises SQL Server (for example, some features do not exist in Azure SQL Database).
trans-unit.target: You have existing IT resources, need full administrative rights over SQL Server, and require the full compatibility with on-premises SQL Server (for example, some features do not exist in Azure SQL Database).

trans-unit.source: This approach lets you minimize costs for development or modifications of existing applications with the flexibility to run most applications.
trans-unit.target: This approach lets you minimize costs for development or modifications of existing applications with the flexibility to run most applications.

trans-unit.source: In addition, it provides full control on the VM, operating system, and database configuration.
trans-unit.target: In addition, it provides full control on the VM, operating system, and database configuration.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Enterprise Library Transient Fault Handling Application Block
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Enterprise Library Transient Fault Handling Application Block

trans-unit.source: This library lets developers make their applications running on Azure SQL Database more resilient by adding robust transient fault handling logic.
trans-unit.target: This library lets developers make their applications running on Azure SQL Database more resilient by adding robust transient fault handling logic.

trans-unit.source: Transient faults are errors that occur because of some temporary condition such as network connectivity issues or service unavailability.
trans-unit.target: Transient faults are errors that occur because of some temporary condition such as network connectivity issues or service unavailability.

trans-unit.source: Since Azure SQL Database is a multitenant service, it is important to handle such errors to minimize any application downtime.
trans-unit.target: Since Azure SQL Database is a multitenant service, it is important to handle such errors to minimize any application downtime.
